title: Scp 8642 11
content:
You politely decline the coffee offered to you by this attractive person. They smile and respect your boundaries, but you can see disappointment in their eyes. Before long they finish their coffee, rinse out the mugs, and disappear into the maze of filing cabinets.

And you are left alone to wait.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

And wait.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

And wait a little more.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

And it’s really getting awkward now, but you’ve committed to sitting here and waiting.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

But dang is it taking a long time while you wait here awkwardly.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

Yep, really awkward just sitting here by yourself in an unfamiliar department.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

You should’ve accepted the coffee, it leads to a much nicer ending.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

But no, you’re just too awkward, and sitting here awkwardly is what you’ve chosen to do.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

Oh, is Greg done? No he’s just getting some papers from the printer.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

Well he’s writing something down, hope it’s for you.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

Nope, that’s a note for Hannah.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

Ok, NOW he must be— nope, more papers from the printer.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

Oh thank goodness, he’s walking over here with the clipboard.
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

But he sure is taking his sweet time, isn’t he?
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _
 _

FINALLY, Greg makes his way over to you and hands you your clipboard. You thank him in a tone that probably sounds more relieved than you wanted. You look through the data he’s written in; it all looks fairly normal: A large amount spent on paper and ink (no surprise there), a moderate amount spent on instant coffee (more than they should, just like every other department in the Foundation), a request for funds going toward better computers and scanners (we’ll see), and…

Upkeep costs for 8 Scranton Reality Anchors? So far you haven’t seen anything in this department that would require a single Reality Anchor, let alone 8. The thought that someone might be embezzling those funds crosses your mind, which would be completely unacceptable for any Foundation department! Then again, this seems to be a strange department, and you can always just note that oddity in your auditing report. They may get investigated by the Auditing Department for it anyways. You could just leave and be done with it, or you could ask and make this awkward situation even more awkward. You decide to…
